query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Dal centro al cerchio, e sì dal cerchio al centro 2 movesi l’acqua in un ritondo vaso, 3 secondo ch’è percosso fuori o dentro:
query.error: **English:** 1 From the center to the rim, and so from the rim to the center, 2 the water moves in a round vessel, 3 according to whether it is struck from outside or from within:
query.result: 1 Madhyāt paridhiṃ prati, tathā paridheḥ madhyam prati, 2 āvartate jalaṃ vartula eke pātre, 3 yathā bāhyeṇa vābhyantarena vā prahṛtam bhavati:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 ne la mia mente fé sùbito caso 5 questo ch’io dico, sì come si tacque 6 la glorïosa vita di Tommaso,
query.error: **English:** 4 in my mind this that I speak of suddenly occurred, 5 as soon as the glorious life of Thomas fell silent, 6 because of the similarity that arose
query.result: 4 mama manasi ayam arthaḥ āsanīyam cakāra, 5 yathā Tommaso-nāmakasya jīvanasya vaibhavam niśśabdam abhavat, 6 tasya vākyasya tathā Beatrice-nāmakāyāḥ vākyasya sādrśyāt,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 per la similitudine che nacque 8 del suo parlare e di quel di Beatrice, 9 a cui sì cominciar, dopo lui, piacque:
query.error: **English:** 7 between his speech and that of Beatrice, 8 to whom it pleased to begin, after him, thus: 9 "This man has need, and he does not tell you
query.result: 7 yā tasya paścāt evam ārabdhum aiṣīt: 8 "Asmai puruṣāya āvaśyakam asti, na ca vām ācaṣṭe 9 nāpi vācā nāpi cintāyā,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 «A costui fa mestieri, e nol vi dice 11 né con la voce né pensando ancora, 12 d’un altro vero andare a la radice.
query.error: **English:** 10 "This man has need, and he does not tell you 11 either with his voice or yet in his thought, 12 of another true way to the root.
query.result: 10 "Asya puruṣasya āvaśyakam asti, na ca vām ācaṣṭe 11 na vā vācā na vā cintāyantīva, 12 anyasya satyasmārgasya mūlābhimukhasya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Diteli se la luce onde s’infiora 14 vostra sustanza, rimarrà con voi 15 etternalmente sì com’ ell’ è ora;
query.error: **English:** 13 Tell me if the light with which your substance is adorned 14 will remain with you eternally, just as it is now; 15 and if it remains, tell me how, after

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 e se rimane, dite come, poi 17 che sarete visibili rifatti, 18 esser porà ch’al veder non vi nòi».
query.error: **English:** 16 you are made visible again, it will be possible 17 that you will not harm our sight."
query.result: 16 Yadi ca sa sthāsyati, vaktavyam mayā katham, paścāt 17 Yūyam punaḥ dṛśyamānāḥ kṛtāḥ, 18 Bhavitum śakyate yathā darśane na naḥ pidayatha."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Come, da più letizia pinti e tratti, 20 a la fïata quei che vanno a rota 21 levan la voce e rallegrano li atti,
query.error: **English:** 19 As those who are drawn and urged by greater joy, 20 at the feast, those who go in procession, 21 raise their voices and gladden their actions,
query.result: 19 Yathā adhikānandena ākrṣṭāḥ pravṛttāś ca, 20 utsave ye gacchanti paryāyeṇa, 21 vācam udghātayanti hṛṣayanti ca kriyāḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 così, a l’orazion pronta e divota, 23 li santi cerchi mostrar nova gioia 24 nel torneare e ne la mira nota.
query.error: **English:** 22 so, at the ready and devout prayer, 23 the saintly circles showed new joy 24 in the circling and in the wonderful melody.
query.result: 22 Tathā, prārthanāyām udyuktāyām bhaktimayīm ca, 23 puṇyāḥ maṇḍalāḥ adarśayan navaṃ hṛṣam 24 paribhramaṇe ca adbhuta-dhvanau ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Qual si lamenta perché qui si moia 26 per viver colà sù, non vide quive 27 lo refrigerio de l’etterna ploia.
query.error: **English:** 25 He who laments because he dies here 26 in order to live up there, does not see here 27 the solace of the eternal rain.
query.result: 25 Yaḥ śocati yataḥ atra mriyate 26 tatra upari jīvitum icchan, na paśyati atra 27 nityavṛṣṭeḥ śāntim.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Quell’ uno e due e tre che sempre vive 29 e regna sempre in tre e ’n due e ’n uno, 30 non circunscritto, e tutto circunscrive,
query.error: **English:** 28 That One and Two and Three who always lives 29 and reigns always in three and two and one, 30 not circumscribed, and circumscribes all,
query.result: 28 Ekaśca dve ca trayaśca yaḥ sadā jīvati 29 traye dve eke ca sadā rājate, 30 aparimitaḥ sarvaṃ parimitavān,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 tre volte era cantato da ciascuno 32 di quelli spirti con tal melodia, 33 ch’ad ogne merto saria giusto muno.
query.error: **English:** 31 was sung three times by each 32 of those spirits with such melody, 33 that to every merit it would be a just reward.
query.result: 31 tribhiḥ tribhiḥ stutaḥ āsīt ekena ekena 32 teṣāṃ prāṇināṃ tādṛśena gītena, 33 yena sarvasya puṇyasya nyāyo dānaṃ syāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 E io udi’ ne la luce più dia 35 del minor cerchio una voce modesta, 36 forse qual fu da l’angelo a Maria,
query.error: **English:** 34 And I heard in the most divine light 35 of the smallest circle a modest voice, 36 perhaps like that of the angel to Mary,
query.result: 34 Aham ca śuśrāva prakāśe atidivye 35 maṇḍalasya kṣudratamasya vāṇīṃ vinītāṃ, 36 yathāpi devadūtasya vāṇī mاريāyāṃ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 risponder: «Quanto fia lunga la festa 38 di paradiso, tanto il nostro amore 39 si raggerà dintorno cotal vesta.
query.error: **English:** 37 answering: "As long as the feast 38 of paradise shall endure, so long 39 our love shall revolve around such a garment."
query.result: 37 pratyuttaradāyikām: "Yāvatkālam utsavaḥ 38 svargasya sthāsyati, tāvatkālam asmākam prema 39 paribhramaṇam kariṣyati veṣṭanam idṛśam."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 La sua chiarezza séguita l’ardore; 41 l’ardor la visïone, e quella è tanta, 42 quant’ ha di grazia sovra suo valore.
query.error: **English:** 40 Its brightness follows the ardor; 41 the ardor, the vision; and that is as great 42 as the grace that is above its worth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Come la carne glorïosa e santa 44 fia rivestita, la nostra persona 45 più grata fia per esser tutta quanta;
query.error: **English:** 43 As the glorious and holy flesh 44 will be reclothed, our person 45 will be more pleasing for being entirely whole;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 per che s’accrescerà ciò che ne dona 47 di gratüito lume il sommo bene, 48 lume ch’a lui veder ne condiziona;
query.error: **English:** 46 because that which the supreme good 47 gives us as a free gift of light will increase, 48 light which conditions us to see him;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 onde la visïon crescer convene, 50 crescer l’ardor che di quella s’accende, 51 crescer lo raggio che da esso vene.
query.error: **English:** 49 whence the vision must increase, 50 the ardor which is kindled by it must increase, 51 the radiance which comes from it must increase.
query.result: 49 Yataḥ darśanam vardhayitum ucitam, 50 Tasmāt darśanāt yaḥ utsaho jāyate sa vardhayitum ucitam, 51 Tasmāt utsahat prabhā yaḥ āgacchati sā vardhayitum ucitā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Ma sì come carbon che fiamma rende, 53 e per vivo candor quella soverchia, 54 sì che la sua parvenza si difende;
query.error: **English:** 52 But just as a coal that fire makes bright, 53 and through its living whiteness that excels, 54 so that its appearance is preserved;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 così questo folgór che già ne cerchia 56 fia vinto in apparenza da la carne 57 che tutto dì la terra ricoperchia;
query.error: **English:** 55 so this lightning that now surrounds us 56 will be vanquished in appearance by the flesh 57 that all day long the earth covers;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 né potrà tanta luce affaticarne: 59 ché li organi del corpo saran forti 60 a tutto ciò che potrà dilettarne».
query.error: **English:** 58 nor will such great light be able to weary us: 59 for the organs of the body will be strong 60 for all that can delight us.
query.result: 58 na ca etāvatī prakāśaḥ asmān klāmayitum śakṣyate: 59 śarīrasya indriyāṇi hi balavānti bhavanti, 60 sarvasmin tasmin yaḥ asmān ānandayitum śaknoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Tanto mi parver sùbiti e accorti 62 e l’uno e l’altro coro a dicer «Amme!», 63 che ben mostrar disio d’i corpi morti:
query.error: **English:** 61 So suddenly and readily did it seem to me 62 that both choirs said to us, "To us!", 63 that they clearly showed their desire for the mortal bodies:
query.result: 61 Tathā mām āścaryam āvirabhūt tatkāle 62 ubhau ca gauṇau "asmābhiḥ saha" iti vadataḥ, 63 yathā mṛtaśarīrāṇāṃ tṛṣṇāṃ niścitam adarśayan:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 forse non pur per lor, ma per le mamme, 65 per li padri e per li altri che fuor cari 66 anzi che fosser sempiterne fiamme.
query.error: **English:** 64 perhaps not only for themselves, but for their mothers, 65 for their fathers and for the others who were dear to them 66 before they became eternal flames.
query.result: 64 kim tu na kevalam ātmanaḥ, api tu mātṛṇām, 65 pitṝṇāṃ ca anyeṣāṃ ca ye pūrvaṃ priyāḥ āsīt 66 pūrvam nityāgninā viyuktānām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Ed ecco intorno, di chiarezza pari, 68 nascere un lustro sopra quel che v’era, 69 per guisa d’orizzonte che rischiari.
query.error: **English:** 67 And behold, all around, equally bright, 68 a light began to shine upon what was there, 69 like a horizon that brightens.
query.result: 67 Tataśca sarvataḥ samaṃ prakāśayantaṃ 68 ekaṃ tejastatra jātam asti, yasmin sthāne tat āsīt, 69 yathā prakāśayati dṛśyamānaḥ cakravālaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 E sì come al salir di prima sera 71 comincian per lo ciel nove parvenze, 72 sì che la vista pare e non par vera,
query.error: **English:** 70 And just as at the approach of early evening 71 new stars begin to appear in the sky, 72 so that the sight seems real and yet not real,
query.result: 70 Evaṃ ca yathā prathama-sāyam-samaye 71 nabhasi navāḥ prakāśāḥ pravartante, 72 yena cakṣuḥ satyam iva mithyā iva ca pratibhāti,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 parvemi lì novelle sussistenze 74 cominciare a vedere, e fare un giro 75 di fuor da l’altre due circunferenze.
query.error: **English:** 73 it seemed to me that new substances 74 began to appear there, and to make a circle 75 outside the other two circumferences.
query.result: 73 tathā tatra navāḥ sattāḥ 74 dṛśyante ārabdhum, kṛtvā ca paridhiṃ 75 anyayoḥ paridhyoḥ bahiḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Oh vero sfavillar del Santo Spiro! 77 come si fece sùbito e candente 78 a li occhi miei che, vinti, nol soffriro!
query.error: **English:** 76 Oh true sparkling of the Holy Spirit! 77 How suddenly and brightly it became 78 to my eyes, which, vanquished, could not bear it!
query.result: 76 Ahaṃ satyasphuliṅgaṃ pavitrasya vāyoḥ! 77 Katham āsīt sāśvatam āśu ca prabhāsvaram ca 78 Mama netra-yugma-dvaye, yat tad aśaknuvantau sahitum, vijitya!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Ma Bëatrice sì bella e ridente 80 mi si mostrò, che tra quelle vedute 81 si vuol lasciar che non seguir la mente.
query.error: **English:** 79 But Beatrice, so beautiful and smiling, 80 showed herself to me, that among those visions 81 one must allow the mind not to follow.
query.result: 79 Tathāpi Bēatrice tathā sundarī ca hasantī ca 80 Mama prati adarśata, yataḥ teṣu dṛśyeṣu 81 Tyājyam manaḥ, ananusaraṇīyam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Quindi ripreser li occhi miei virtute 83 a rilevarsi; e vidimi translato 84 sol con mia donna in più alta salute.
query.error: **English:** 82 Then my eyes regained their strength 83 to rise up; and I saw myself translated, 84 alone with my lady, to a higher salvation.
query.result: 82 Tatra mama cakṣuṣī punar balam prāptum 83 utthātum; paśyāmi ca ātmānam anyatra sthāpitam 84 eka eva mama svāminyā saha uttamām śreyasam prati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Ben m’accors’ io ch’io era più levato, 86 per l’affocato riso de la stella, 87 che mi parea più roggio che l’usato.
query.error: **English:** 85 I realized that I had climbed higher, 86 because of the fiery glow of the star, 87 which seemed redder to me than usual.
query.result: 85 Suṣṭhu jānāmi aham adhunā uttama sthāne vartate, 86 Tārāyāḥ tejasvinā hasitena, 87 Yā mama adhika raktavarṇā dṛśyate pūrvatasya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Con tutto ’l core e con quella favella 89 ch’è una in tutti, a Dio feci olocausto, 90 qual conveniesi a la grazia novella.
query.error: **English:** 88 With all my heart and with that speech 89 which is one in all, I made a burnt offering to God, 90 as is fitting for the new grace.
query.result: 88 Sarveṇa hṛdayena saha tena vācā 89 Yā sarveṣām ekaiva, Devāya juhāva, 90 Yathā navāya anugrahāya ucitam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 E non er’ anco del mio petto essausto 92 l’ardor del sacrificio, ch’io conobbi 93 esso litare stato accetto e fausto;
query.error: **English:** 91 And the ardor of sacrifice was not yet exhausted in my wearied breast, by which I knew 92 that that sacrifice had been accepted and propitious; 93 for with so much brightness and so many rays

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 ché con tanto lucore e tanto robbi 95 m’apparvero splendor dentro a due raggi, 96 ch’io dissi: «O Elïòs che sì li addobbi!».
query.error: **English:** 94 did splendor appear to me within two beams, 95 that I said: "O Helios, who adorn yourself thus!"
query.result: 94 Yasmāt tathāprakāśena tathā ca raśmibhiḥ 95 Tejas mayi adarśata dveṣu raśmiṣu, 96 Yataḥ aham uvāca: "He Sūrya, yaḥ evam ātmabhūṣaṇaṃ karoṣi!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Come distinta da minori e maggi 98 lumi biancheggia tra ’ poli del mondo 99 Galassia sì, che fa dubbiar ben saggi;
query.error: **English:** 97 As distinct from lesser and greater lights, 98 a white radiance gleams between the poles of the world, 99 the Milky Way, which makes even wise men doubt;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 sì costellati facean nel profondo 101 Marte quei raggi il venerabil segno 102 che fan giunture di quadranti in tondo.
query.error: **English:** 100 so, too, in the depths of Mars, those rays made 101 the venerable sign that forms the juncture of the quadrants in a circle.
query.result: 100 tathāpi Kuja-madhye te kiraṇāḥ 101 pūjyaṃ lakṣaṇaṃ cakruḥ 102 yaḥ catuḥ-koṇa-saṁdhiḥ maṇḍala-ākāraḥ.

query.error: **English:** 103 Here my memory overcomes my intellect, 104 for that cross flashed with Christ, 105 so that I cannot find a worthy comparison;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 ma chi prende sua croce e segue Cristo, 107 ancor mi scuserà di quel ch’io lasso, 108 vedendo in quell’ albor balenar Cristo.
query.error: **English:** 106 but whoever takes up his cross and follows Christ, 107 will still excuse me for what I lack, 108 seeing Christ shine forth in that dawn.
query.result: 106 yaḥ kaścid api sva-śilūṣāṃ gṛhṇāti Khristaṃ ca anveti, 107 sa mama kṣamāṃ dāsyati asmāt kleśāt, 108 tasminn ālokāvalokya Khristam prakāśamānam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Di corno in corno e tra la cima e ’l basso 110 si movien lumi, scintillando forte 111 nel congiugnersi insieme e nel trapasso:
query.error: **English:** 109 From horn to horn and between the summit and the base, 110 lights were moving, sparkling brightly 111 as they came together and passed by:
query.result: 109 Śṛṅgāt śṛṅgam prati ca śikhara-tala-madhye ca 110 Jyotir-gaṇāḥ pracalanti, tibra-prakāśamānāḥ 111 Saṃyojanāt vibhajanāt ca parasparam:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 così si veggion qui diritte e torte, 113 veloci e tarde, rinovando vista, 114 le minuzie d’i corpi, lunghe e corte,
query.error: **English:** 112 thus one sees here, straight and crooked, 113 fast and slow, renewing the sight, 114 the minute particles of bodies, long and short,
query.result: 112 Evam ihāpi dṛśyante ṛju-vakrāḥ, 113 Kṣipra-mandaḥ, dṛśyam punar-api kurvantaḥ, 114 Deha-kaṇāḥ, dīrghāḥ hrasvāḥ ca,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 moversi per lo raggio onde si lista 116 talvolta l’ombra che, per sua difesa, 117 la gente con ingegno e arte acquista.
query.error: **English:** 115 moving through the beam of light that sometimes streaks 116 the shadow that people, with their ingenuity and skill, 117 acquire for their protection.
query.result: 115 Calanti tasmin raśmau yasya prakāśena 116 Chāyā kadācit ālikhyate, yām ātma-rakṣaṇāya 117 Manujaḥ prayatnena kalayā ca labhate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 E come giga e arpa, in tempra tesa 119 di molte corde, fa dolce tintinno 120 a tal da cui la nota non è intesa,
query.error: **English:** 118 And as a zither and a harp, in tune with 119 many strings, make sweet tinkling 120 to one for whom the notes are not understood,
query.result: 118 Evaṃ vīṇāyāḥ vīṇāyāśca samaṃ svabhāvena 119 Anekaśrutibhiḥ madhuram ṭhaṇiṭhaṃ jāyate 120 Yasya śravaṇe śabdaḥ na jñāyate,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 così da’ lumi che lì m’apparinno 122 s’accogliea per la croce una melode 123 che mi rapiva, sanza intender l’inno.
query.error: **English:** 121 so from the lights that there appeared to me 122 a melody was gathering around the cross 123 that enraptured me, without my understanding the hymn.
query.result: 121 Tathā tatra me prakāśamānānām dīpānām 122 Kṛṣasya paritaḥ samāveśataikaṃ gītam 123 Yena aham ākrāntaḥ abhavam, stutiṃ na jñātvā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Ben m’accors’ io ch’elli era d’alte lode, 125 però ch’a me venìa «Resurgi» e «Vinci» 126 come a colui che non intende e ode.
query.error: **English:** 124 I realized well that he was worthy of high praise, 125 but to me he kept saying "Resurgi" and "Vinci" 126 like to someone who hears but does not understand.
query.result: 124 Suṣṭhu manye aham tam uttama-stuti-pātram, 125 tataś ca mama prati āgacchat "Resurgi" iti ca "Vinci" iti ca, 126 yathā tasmai yaḥ śṛṇoti na ca vijānāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Ïo m’innamorava tanto quinci, 128 che ’nfino a lì non fu alcuna cosa 129 che mi legasse con sì dolci vinci.
query.error: **English:** 127 I fell in love so much there, 128 that up to that point there was nothing 129 that bound me with such sweet bonds.
query.result: 127 Aham tatra tathā prītim alabhāmi sma, 128 Yāvat tatra na kaścid api vastu asti, 129 Yat māṃ tathā madhurair bandhanaiḥ badhnāti sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Forse la mia parola par troppo osa, 131 posponendo il piacer de li occhi belli, 132 ne’ quai mirando mio disio ha posa;
query.error: **English:** 130 Perhaps my words seem too bold, 131 since I put aside the pleasure of those beautiful eyes, 132 in whose gaze my desire finds repose;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 ma chi s’avvede che i vivi suggelli 134 d’ogne bellezza più fanno più suso, 135 e ch’io non m’era lì rivolto a quelli,
query.error: **English:** 133 but whoever understands that living birds 134 surpass all other beauties, and that I had not turned to them there,
query.result: 133 kaścid yadi jānāti yathā jīvantaḥ pakṣiṇaḥ 134 sarva-saundaryeṇa atiricyante ūrdhvam, 135 atha ca aham tatra teṣu na pravṛttaḥ āsam,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 escusar puommi di quel ch’io m’accuso 137 per escusarmi, e vedermi dir vero: 138 ché ’l piacer santo non è qui dischiuso,
query.error: **English:** 136 can excuse me for what I accuse myself of, 137 in order to excuse myself and see that I am telling the truth: 138 for holy pleasure is not revealed here,
query.result: 136 sa mama kṣamāṃ kartum śaknoti, yena aham ātmānam abhiyujyāmi, 137 ātmānam kṣantum, mama satyam jñātum ca: 138 yataḥ pavitra-sukhaṃ na atra prakāśyate,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 perché si fa, montando, più sincero.
query.error: **English:** 139 because it becomes purer as one ascends.
query.result: 139 yataḥ ārohaṇena tat viśuddhataram bhavati.
